version_description:
New in 3.3.47:
- Bright and shiny updates for your bright and shiny iPhone 7 and iOS 10
- 8tracks Plus, our subscription service that allows unlimited ad-free streaming, gif artwork, and other cool stuff now in full swing
- All the badges! Artists, labels, music blogs, and so on – if you’ve invested in 8tracks, you also have a badge that lets everyone else know how important you are to us
- Sprayed down with some all-natural pesticides to get rid of a few pesky bugs
- Fix for trouble with playback on iPhone 5s

3.0 improvements:
- Animated playlist covers like we’re in Harry Potter or something
- 8tracks Timeline: review playlists you’ve heard and upcoming playlists, travel through time and space
- Sleep timer: go to sleep whenever the heck you want without leaving the app running
- Tumblr sharing, in addition to Facebook, Twitter, text, email, link, Tinder (just kidding… maybe)
- Sidebar access to your playlist collections

While we’d really rather not have any limits on listening, we’ve exhausted all possible options to keep 8tracks free for everyone, as it has been for the past 8 years. Unfortunately, with increases in royalty rates and operating costs, we have no choice but to shift towards subscriptions (which we’ve priced as affordably as possible) to ensure a healthy future for our service and the community. Please copy and paste this blog post from our CEO into your browser to learn why these changes had to happen: https://blog.8tracks.com/2016/12/12/independent-radio-and-the-challenges-of-streaming-music/

While we’d really rather not have any limits on listening, we’ve exhausted all possible options to keep 8tracks free for everyone, as it has been for the past 8 years. Unfortunately, with increases in royalty rates, we have no choice but to shift towards subscriptions for listeners in the US (which we’ve priced as affordably as possible) to ensure a healthy future for our service and the community.

Performance improvements, bug fixes, and a whole lotta style.

*** Community Update ***

While we’d really rather not have any limits on listening, we’ve exhausted all short-term options to keep 8tracks free for everyone, as it has been for the past 9 years. Unfortunately, with recent increases in royalty rates, we have no choice but to shift towards subscriptions for listeners in the US (which we’ve priced as affordably as possible). Everyone can still listen for free, but there is a weekly limit which resets each Monday. In the meantime, we’re exploring new ways to allow us to raise the free listening limit while still ensuring a healthy future for our service and the community. Thanks for continuing to support 8tracks!

You now get a lot more free listening each week thanks to new audio ads!

8tracks is back! After a short self-quarantine, we've relaunched streaming of your favorite playlists.

Some playlists have been temporarily removed and some tracks on existing playlists will temporarily force-skip due to new licensing requirements.
Rest assured, we will have these tracks and playlists back soon.

The vast majority of your favorite content is now available to stream!

Minor fixes and speed enhancements.

8tracks is back! After a short self-quarantine, we've relaunched streaming of your favorite playlists.

Some playlists have been temporarily removed and some tracks on existing playlists will temporarily force-skip due to new licensing requirements.
Rest assured, we will have these tracks and playlists back soon.

The vast majority of your favorite content is now available to stream!
